title: ACC granted funding to make batteries in Germany
notes:
Location:
- The battery cell factory project is located in Kaiserslautern, Germany, as part of the EU’s Battery IPCEI.

Capacity:
- The project aims to achieve a total production capacity of 24 GWh per year, with an initial phase leading to 8 GWh output scheduled to start in 2023. Battery production in Kaiserslautern is expected to begin in 2025.

Investment amounts:
- The federal and state governments are funding the project with a total of 436.8 million euros. The companies involved in the joint venture are investing over two billion euros for this purpose.

Project progress:
- ACC, the Franco-German consortium, fired the starting gun to kick-off pilot production in January 2020 at a Saft facility in France. The first phase of construction is set to start in 2023, with battery production in Kaiserslautern expected to begin in 2025.

Project type:
- The project involves the construction of a new battery cell factory in Kaiserslautern, Germany.

Value chain stages:
- The project covers cell technology development and battery production, aiming to produce battery cells for around 500,000 electric vehicles annually.

Note: The information provided is based on the articles related to the project.

title: Germany: ACC Receives €437 Million To Build Battery Gigafactory
notes:
Location:
- Germany, Kaiserslautern, Rhineland-Palatinate state

Capacity:
- Planned capacity of 8 GWh annually, with expansion to 24 GWh annually later this decade

Investment amounts:
- Total funding of about €437 million ($519 million), including €386 million from the Federal Ministry of Economics and Technology and €52 million from the state of Rhineland-Palatinate
- Intended investment of €5 billion in the two plants, with €1.3 billion expected to come from the European Union

Project progress:
- Established in September 2020
- Construction scheduled to start in 2023
- Production expected to begin in 2025
- Expected to supply enough battery cells for up to 500,000 electric cars annually

Project type:
- New build gigafactory

Value chain stages:
- Cathode and anode manufacturing
- Cell fabrication
- Module assembly

title: A PSA-Total battery factory for Hauts-de-France
notes:
Location:
- The project involves the construction of automotive gigafactories in Douvrin, France (Hauts-de-France region) and Kaiserslautern, Germany.

Capacity:
- The cumulative capacity of both sites is planned to reach 48GWh by 2030, with production set to start in 2023.

Investment amounts:
- The project represents an investment of more than €5 billion, including financial support of €1.3 billion from the French and German public authorities.

Project progress:
- The project was announced in January 2020 and confirmed in September 2020. The R&D and development have already started at the R&D site in Bordeaux and the pilot site in Nersac. Mass production is due to start in 2023.

Project type:
- The project involves the construction of new gigafactories for battery production.

Value chain stages:
- The project covers R&D, mass production, and aims to equip 1 million electric vehicles per year, representing more than 10% of the European market.

Note: The project aims to support energy transition in the automotive industry and ensure Europe’s industrial independence in battery production.
